intro: Stisseria stricta, commonly known as the narrowleaf stisseria, is a species of flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants commonly known as buckwheats. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, lance-shaped leaves that are typically arranged alternately along the stem. Its flowers are clustered in dense, cylindrical inflorescences and are usually greenish or reddish in color. Stisseria stricta is often found in moist, shaded environments such as woodland areas and stream banks.
